newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian Air offers extra flights to Sarajevo.
newsitem.headline: Austrian Air offers extra flights to Sarajevo.

text.p: Austrian Airlines, the first western European airline to offer a direct service to Sarajevo, said on Wednesday it had put on two extra flights a week to the Bosnian capital to meet strong customer demand.
The airline said the service was now operating on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday as well as Saturday and Sunday.
Austrian Airlines resumed flights to Sarajevo last month after a four-year break. The capital's battle-scarred airport reopened to commercial traffic in August 1996.
The only other foreign companies to fly to Sarajevo are Croatia Airlines from Zagreb and Slovenia's Adria Airlines via Zagreb.
